citeinfo.title: LIBRARIES_ISL_IN: Libraries in Indiana (Indiana State Library, Point Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: Street addresses and information regarding type of facility were obtained from a Web page of the Indiana State Library (http://www.statelib.lib.in.us/www/isl/ldo/pldir/pldir06.html). Personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey used ESRI ArcMap 9.2 to build an "Address Locator" and used the "Geocoding" tool to perform address-matching, using street information licensed from Tele Atlas, Dynamap/2000, v. 17.0. Where street addresses did not provide acceptable match scores, personnel of the IGS used Google searches, Mapquest, and inspection of imagery from the 2005 Indiana Orthophotography Project to plot locations. Where no street addresses were avaialable, locations were plotted near town centers.

descript.abstract: LIBRARIES_ISL_IN is a point shapefile showing the locations of 528 libraries included in Microsoft Excel spreadsheets that are downloadable from the Web page named "Public Library Directory Information" of the Indiana State Library (ISL) (http://www.statelib.lib.in.us/www/isl/ldo/pldir/pldir06.html). The spreadsheets used included "06acadlib.xls" (academic libraries), "plmail2006.xls" (public libraries), and "plbranch2006.xls" (public branch libraries). Using street addresses from the downloaded spreadsheets, shapefiles were created using the "Geocoding" tool in ESRI ArcMap 9.2 and street information licensed from Tele Atlas, Dynamap/2000, v. 17.0. The shapefiles were then merged using the "Merge" tool in ESRI ArcToolbox.
descript.purpose: This data set was compiled to create a GIS layer showing locations of libraries in Indiana.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS version 9.2 shapefile format, approximately 475 Kb

attracc.attraccr: Street addresses for libraries were obtained from the Web site of the Indiana State Library and are assumed to be accurate. Geocoding produced match scores of more than 80 percent for about 90 percent of libraries obtained from the "Public Library Directory Information" of the Indiana State Library. Locations of other libraries were plotted by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey using the "Editor" tool in ESRI ArcMap version 9.2, together with information obtained through Google searches, MapQuest (http://www.mapquest.com/maps/), and inspection of aerial photographs of the 2005 Indiana Orthophotography Project. Where no addresses were available, points were plotted near town centers.

dataqual.logic: No checks for logical consistency were made.
dataqual.complete: All academic, public, and public branch libraries listed by the Indiana State Library have been included.

horizpa.horizpar: For match scores greater than 80 percent, plotted locations are generally within several hundred feet of actual locations.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

citeinfo.title: Dynamap 2000
citeinfo.othercit: Indiana Roads from Tele Atlas, Dynamap/2000, v. 17.0, licensed to the Indiana Geological Survey

srcinfo.srccitea: Indiana Roads from Tele Atlas, Dynamap 2000, v. 17.0
srcinfo.srccontr: Indiana streets and roads suitable for geocoding

procstep.procdesc: Street addresses for each academic, public, and public branch library were obtained by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) from the Indiana State Library, Public Library Directory Information (http://www.statelib.lib.in.us/www/isl/ldo/pldir/pldir06.html). The library address lists were saved as comma-delimited text files named "06acadlib_csv.txt," "plmail2006_csv.txt," and "plbranch2006_csv.txt."

IGS personnel used street information licensed from Tele Atlas in ESRI ArcMap 9.2 to build an "Address Locator." Using the "Geocoding" tool to perform address-matching, the comma-delimited text files named "06acadlib_csv.txt," "plmail2006_csv.txt," and "plbranch2006_csv.txt" were address matched. Forty-one (41) locations were manually plotted using the "Editor" tool in ESRI ArcMap, as well as locations plotted by MapQuest and inspection of aerial photographs of the 2005 Indiana Orthophotography Project. The output was saved as LIBRARIES_ACADEMIC_IN.SHP, LIBRARIES_PUBLIC_IN.SHP, and LIBRARIES_PUBBRANCH.SHP. In the attribute tables of these shapefiles, the field named "ARC_Street" was renamed as "GeoAddress," and the field named "Arc_Zone" was renamed as "GeoZip." The fields named "Side" and "Zip" were deleted. The three shapefiles were then merged into a single shapefile named "LIBRARIES_ISL_IN.SHP" using the "Merge" tool in ESRI ArcToolbox.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

edom.edomvd: Originally either an "unmatched" address in batch geocoding or a matched address with a low (less than 80) match score. Location was subsequently plotted or revised by personnel of the IGS.

attr.attrdef: In geocoding, a value is assigned to all potential candidates for an address match. The match score is based on how well the location found in the reference data matches with the address data being searched.
Name of branch of a public library
Address of library obtained from directories of the Indiana State Library, as street address and (or) post-office box
The address of library used for geocoding, obtained from either directories of the Indiana State Library or through Internet searches conducted by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey.
City in which library is located
Type of library. Types include Academic, Public, and Public Branch.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone other than the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
